maddisondesigns commented Mar 14, 2013

Hi,

It would be great to see a Gallery type icon. I would imagine it would be similar to icon-picture, but instead of the one "picture", it would be multiple, stacked. Similar to the quick mockup I've attached below.

I do a lot of WordPress development and WordPress has various Post Formats. Among them are an Image Post Format and a Gallery Post Format. The icon-picture is perfect for the Image Post Format and I would love to see a new icon-gallery that I could use for the Gallery Post Format.

Cheers! And thanks for the great work you've done on these so far. :-)

To-mos commented Dec 3, 2016

I've quit using Font Awesome specifically because of no gallery icon. The closest thing I could find was the copy icon or just doubling up the image icon...

cherrador commented Dec 3, 2016

@To-mos I use FA for web applications and I was on the same dilemma as yours, until I figured how effectively use font stacks. Now I am able to create my own compositions that I now use on my application. Previously, on this thread, I gave a suggestion of how this can be done for the gallery icon. Additional, as proof, here is a sample how I using stacks on a web application already in production.

Of course it needs the CSS extension that I also suggested.

Sorry, something went wrong.

To-mos commented Dec 3, 2016 •
edited

@cherrador Unfortunately stacks don't allow the icons behind to be transparent without masking off the foreground one and I didn't really need/want an extra extension so I just made 2 svg icons for people to use in a gist.
Hope they help :)
https://gist.github.com/To-mos/69ebaa3dae76afa511efe38683ab39b2

Pick your reaction

Pick your reaction

Sorry, something went wrong.

cherrador commented Dec 3, 2016 •
edited

@To-mos You are right about this. Some compositions could be challenging without using masking. We also when we cannot find a reliable icon or stack, we use SVG. Which normally I try to avoid because they live on a separate file that needs to be loaded and also about the limitation that cannot be colored or modified with CSS when they are loaded as src. Normally, I have javascript that finds and converts all the loaded SVG into <svg> tags after finishing loading which then I can style without problem.

Also, as I suggested before, some basic geometrical icon shapes could be very useful to complete some of the stacks without reliance on masks.

visualpharm commented Jun 4, 2017 •
edited

I've started a campaign, giving away the top requests for FA icons for free, open source. You can incorporate them in a number of ways: generating another icon font, svg set, or (my preference) compiling all FA and third party icons into a single file.

The gallery icon is here.

Previous ones were moderator, discord, coins, Google Play, thin close, walking man, t-shirt, Xbox, Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo, PlayStation, Facebook messenger, Line, clean and math icons.

Please let me know if you want me keep going these icon requests, or compile some upgrade file.
